Subject: RE: Store Incident 03/12/24

Dear Hagop,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

We are seeking your guidance regarding an incident where a customer damaged her Hermes shoes at the Jacquemus boutique. The damage occurred when the customer inadvertently struck the corner of the fitting room, resulting in harm to the shoes. The customer is now requesting reimbursement and is willing to provide the invoice for the purchase.

 

For your reference, I have attached the Summary from our GSCR.

 

We would appreciate your advice on how to proceed with this matter.

 

Kind regards,

 

KAWTTAR NASSIK​​​​

SENIOR ASSOCIATE ‑ RSO

ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC

Dear Diane,

 

I hope you are doing well ,

 

I am writing to inform you about an incident that occurred in our store on 03/12/2024, involving a client who injured herself and damaged personal property.

 

The client accidentally bumped her foot on a edge of the fitting room door in the store, resulting in a damage to  her Hermes shoes damaged during the incident. She expressed concern about the damage to her belongings and has requested to know what steps we will take to address the matter.

 

We have already expressed our apologies to the client and assured her that we are investigating the cause of the incident. I have requested further details from her regarding the damaged shoes to assess how best to proceed with resolving the issue and I am adding them here.

 

Please let me know about the possible solution we can provide for this client.

 

Many thanks,

 

 

 

 

MILOS PEJIC​​​​
